speaker: Laura
text: Hey, we should start early on Saturday if we want to reach the summit before noon.
ipa: heɪ | wi ʃʊd stɑrt ˈɜrli ɑn ˈsætərˌdeɪ | ɪf wi wɑnt tu riʧ ðə ˈsʌmɪt bɪˈfɔr nun
stress: HEY | we SHOULD START EARLY on SATURDAY | if we WANT to REACH the SUMMIT before NOON
linking:
"should start" → /ʃʊd stɑrt/ (d links to s)
"want to" → /wɑnt tu/ (t links to t)

speaker: Ben
text: Yeah, especially because the weather might change later in the day. We must pack enough water and snacks too.
ipa: jæ | ɪˈspɛʃəli bɪˈkɔz ðə ˈwɛðər maɪt ʧeɪnʤ ˈleɪtər ɪn ðə deɪ | wi mʌst pæk ɪˈnʌf ˈwɔtər ənd snæks tu
stress: YEAH | especially BECAUSE the WEATHER might CHANGE LATER in the DAY | we MUST PACK enough WATER and SNACKS too
linking:
"weather might" → /ˈwɛðər maɪt/ (r links to m)
"must pack" → /mʌst pæk/ (t links to p)

speaker: Laura
text: Definitely. Also, we ought to check the trail conditions online. Some paths could still be closed after last week's storm.
ipa: ˈdɛfənətli | ˈɔlsoʊ | wi ɔt tu ʧɛk ðə treɪl kənˈdɪʃənz ˈɔnˌlaɪn | səm pæθs kʊd stɪl bi kloʊzd ˈæftər læst wiks stɔrm
stress: DEFINITELY | ALSO | we OUGHT TO CHECK the TRAIL CONDITIONS ONLINE | some PATHS could STILL be CLOSED after LAST WEEK'S STORM
linking:
"ought to" → /ɔt tu/ (t links to t)
"be closed" → /bi kloʊzd/ (i links to k)

speaker: Ben
text: Good idea. Oh, and remember, we have to get a hiking permit from the park office. They won't let us in without it.
ipa: ɡʊd aɪˈdiə | oʊ | ənd rɪˈmɛmbər | wi hæv tu ɡɛt ə ˈhaɪkɪŋ ˈpɜrmɪt frəm ðə pɑrk ˈɔfəs | ðeɪ woʊnt lɛt ʌs ɪn wɪˈðaʊt ɪt
stress: GOOD IDEA | OH | and REMEMBER | we HAVE TO GET a HIKING PERMIT from the PARK OFFICE | they WON'T LET US IN WITHOUT IT
linking:
"have to" → /hæv tu/ (v links to t)
"let us" → /lɛt ʌs/ (t links to u)

speaker: Laura
text: Right, I almost forgot! Do you think we should bring an extra jacket? It might get cold up there.
ipa: raɪt | aɪ ˈɔlmoʊst fərˈɡɑt | du ju θɪŋk wi ʃʊd brɪŋ ən ˈɛkstrə ˈʤækɪt | ɪt maɪt ɡɛt koʊld ʌp ðɛr
stress: RIGHT | I ALMOST FORGOT | do YOU THINK we SHOULD BRING an EXTRA JACKET | it MIGHT GET COLD UP THERE
linking:
"should bring" → /ʃʊd brɪŋ/ (d links to b)
"get cold" → /ɡɛt koʊld/ (t links to k)

speaker: Ben
text: Better to be prepared. You don't have to bring heavy gear, but a windbreaker would be smart.
ipa: ˈbɛtər tu bi prɪˈpɛrd | ju doʊnt hæv tu brɪŋ ˈhɛvi ɡɪr | bʌt ə ˈwɪndˌbreɪkər wʊd bi smɑrt
stress: BETTER TO BE PREPARED | you DON'T HAVE TO BRING HEAVY GEAR | but a WINDBREAKER WOULD BE SMART
linking:
"don't have" → /doʊnt hæv/ (t links to h)
"would be" → /wʊd bi/ (d links to b)

speaker: Laura
text: Got it. Also, we might want to bring a flashlight. Just in case something delays us.
ipa: ɡɑt ɪt | ˈɔlsoʊ | wi maɪt wɑnt tu brɪŋ ə ˈflæʃˌlaɪt | ʤʌst ɪn keɪs ˈsʌmθɪŋ dɪˈleɪz ʌs
stress: GOT IT | ALSO | we MIGHT WANT TO BRING a FLASHLIGHT | JUST IN CASE SOMETHING DELAYS US
linking:
"want to" → /wɑnt tu/ (t links to t)
"just in" → /ʤʌst ɪn/ (t links to i)

speaker: Ben
text: True. Even though we plan to be back before dark, anything could happen. We shouldn't underestimate the trail.
ipa: tru | ˈivən ðoʊ wi plæn tu bi bæk bɪˈfɔr dɑrk | ˈɛniˌθɪŋ kʊd ˈhæpən | wi ˈʃʊdənt ˌʌndərˈɛstəˌmeɪt ðə treɪl
stress: TRUE | EVEN THOUGH we PLAN TO BE BACK BEFORE DARK | ANYTHING COULD HAPPEN | we SHOULDN'T UNDERESTIMATE the TRAIL
linking:
"plan to" → /plæn tu/ (n links to t)
"shouldn't underestimate" → /ˈʃʊdənt ˌʌndərˈɛstəˌmeɪt/ (t links to u)

speaker: Laura
text: Agreed! I'm excited — this will be an awesome adventure if we plan it right!
ipa: əˈɡrid | aɪm ɪkˈsaɪtɪd | ðɪs wɪl bi ən ˈɔsəm ædˈvɛnʧər ɪf wi plæn ɪt raɪt
stress: AGREED | I'M EXCITED — this WILL BE an AWESOME ADVENTURE if we PLAN IT RIGHT
linking:
"will be" → /wɪl bi/ (l links to b)
"plan it" → /plæn ɪt/ (n links to i)

speaker: Noah
text: Exactly. I'll see if I can draw up a quick comparison sheet before the meeting.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | aɪl si ɪf aɪ kən drɔ ʌp ə kwɪk kəmˈpɛrəsən ʃit bɪˈfɔr ðə ˈmitɪŋ
stress: EXACTLY | I'll SEE if I CAN DRAW UP a QUICK COMPARISON SHEET before the MEETING
linking:
"I'll see" → /aɪl si/ (l links to s)
"see if I can" → /si ɪf aɪ kən/ (smooth transitions)
"draw up" → /drɔ ʌp/ (draw + up linked)
"sheet before" → /ʃit bɪˈfɔr/ (t links to b)
